content.description: Do a no hands start in the cave facing outward. Turn inward, then traverse left on good jugs, linking up with Seam Stress. Get techy to avoid the barn door.NOTE: eliminator... stay low, and avoid the boulder jumble/crack area above as you head left to the link up of Seam Stress.
content.location: The start location is: cave. It is just left of Moment of Uncertainty.

content.description: Seam Stress is a classic New England, lowball problem.... Crouch start with  left hand on obvious, flat edge.  right hand on a lower right pinch. Find feet and bump up right. Work the crack system, then top out using V finger lock.  sustained and techy.
content.location: on the lowball face block left of the cave.

content.description: Stand start in the cave, and grab buckets to round the corner. High step to a ledge, and work the hands-to-fist-jam crack to the top. This is a good route for young kids to get some practice on.
content.location: It is the obvious crack on the right side of the cave.

content.description: Stand start left of the bulge.  left hand chest high in a good sidepull (vertical seam). Find feet and head straight up to a slabby topout (crux).
content.location: It is the slab line just left of Cellulite Delight.

content.description: Stand start just right of the arête (right of Cellulite Delight). Establish, move up, and match on the rail above (crux). Then cruise to the top.
content.location: It is trail side, right of the arête / Cellulite Delight.

content.description: Sit start at the arête trailside with left hand high on a crack/side-pull (just above the black friction dish).  Bump to the crack trending left, and traverse left under the bulge. Best the bulge (crux) to a high topout.
content.location: It ascends the bulge face (trail side).

content.description: Elephant Man Boulder is a 15-ish foot tall block with an obvious bulge facing trailside. Left of the nose you'll find a small boulder perched on top of yet another block (nice face), which creates a small cave in between the two. The backside of this cluster is half buried, making for no-sweat downclimbs.There are no access issues.
